title: (x) Cyworld logo blurred sans - Gureum M {Brian Jongseong Park}
content:
Can anyone tell me what font this is, that’s being used in the Cyworld logo?

[http://www.morpheusmedia.com/mlog/images/cyworld\_logo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229080056/http:/www.morpheusmedia.com/mlog/images/cyworld_logo.gif "http://www.morpheusmedia.com/mlog/images/cyworld\_logo.gif")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229080056im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/cyworld_4348.jpeg)

I’m seeing a resurgence with this typeface everywhere i go. I swear. At least i think that’s the one. Makes me think early to mid 90s for some reason.

 [‹ Beautiful font similar to URW Grotesk or Avenir](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229080056/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32371 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Roy Lichtenstein white sans caps - Adobe Sans MM (DIN Neuzeit Grotesk) {Yves (Nick Job)} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229080056/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31847 "Go to next forum topic")
author: drewkopietz

comments.content: Perhaps your flashback to the ’90s is caused by [FF Blur](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229080056/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.11713.0.2&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=cyworld&sampleSize=48) which is close, but not it. Nor is [Frankfurter](http://web.archive.org/) or [VAG](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229080056/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=BT.122378.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=cyworld&sampleSize=48).

Perhaps you’re thinking of FF Blur, which was indeed all the rage in the last decade of the last century? Unfortunately, that’s not what this type is.

[http://www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayf...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229080056/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.2795.3.8&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=cyworld&sampleSize=24 "http://www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.2795.3.8&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=cyworld&sampleSize=24")

Its a modded version of VAG... Looks the median filter was applied to it in photoshop- my guess of course. There are a few other adjustments too.

You find the very popular VAG here. VAG= Volkwagen of Germany. Cute huh?

Mike Diaz :-)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229080056im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/cyworld1_5434.gif)

Thank you guys for all the feedback! I knew it wasn’t VAG. I considered in the back of my head, that it could’ve been VAG with a modified filter applied to it in photoshop but wrote it off. I’d seen the font in too many other places to assume that it was a technique applied over and over again.

Actually it’s probably either FF Blur medium or bold. That looks about right. Couldn’t possibly be anything else right?
Yes I did... I started typing a reply to this post before there already was one and when I posted all the smart kids beat me to it and there was a bunch of stuff and .... :-)
It’s scary, isn’t it Stephen? Right down to the similar sentence construction.
I’m outta here, this is too weird!

\> _Actually it’s probably either FF Blur medium or bold. That looks about right. Couldn’t possibly be anything else right?_

No it’s not. I believe there are a couple of fonts — also non-released stuff from students — from the grunge boom that are similar, and it could be one of them.
I thought it might be [North Bergen](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229080056/http:/cubanica.com/font/northbergen/regular.html), but no.

Another close-but-no-cigar option: Autostyler, available free upon request from the fine folk at Autodidakt:

[http://autodidakt.se/index.php?page=autostyler](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229080056/http:/autodidakt.se/index.php?page=autostyler "http://autodidakt.se/index.php?page=autostyler")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229080056im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/autostyler_mo_5467.jpg)

It looks like 구름 M (_Gureum_, meaning “cloud”, and M standing for medium weight) offered by the Korean font outfit [윤디자인 (YoonDesign)](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229080056/http:/yoonfont.co.kr/shop/han_view.asp?itemidx=723). In fact, you can see the Cyworld logo on the [front page](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229080056/http:/yoonfont.co.kr/) for their website. I can’t find any further information on the design, though.

Korean fonts include latin alphabet glyphs by default in addition to the hangul (Korean alphabet). It is pretty common, I imagine, for Korean designers to use the latin alphabet component of their Korean fonts for latin-alphabet logos.
Another option is the fairly new [Chocolat](http://web.archive.org/web/20071229080056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/chocolat/?refby=typographica), which appears to be a blurred Futura.

As for the Cyworld logo itself, though, I think it’s pretty much settled that the font used is Gureum M. YoonDesign wouldn’t display it as a prominent example of one of their fonts in use on the front page of their website if that wasn’t the case.
